trans-unit.source: What are Service Bus Queues?
trans-unit.target: What are Service Bus Queues?

trans-unit.source: Service Bus queues support a **brokered messaging** communication
trans-unit.target: Service Bus queues support a **brokered messaging** communication

trans-unit.source: model.
trans-unit.target: model.

trans-unit.source: When using queues, components of a distributed application do not
trans-unit.target: When using queues, components of a distributed application do not

trans-unit.source: communicate directly with each other; instead they exchange messages via
trans-unit.target: communicate directly with each other; instead they exchange messages via

trans-unit.source: a queue, which acts as an intermediary (broker).
trans-unit.target: a queue, which acts as an intermediary (broker).

trans-unit.source: A message producer (sender)
trans-unit.target: A message producer (sender)

trans-unit.source: hands off a message to the queue and then continues its processing.
trans-unit.target: hands off a message to the queue and then continues its processing.

trans-unit.source: Asynchronously, a message consumer (receiver) pulls the message from the
trans-unit.target: Asynchronously, a message consumer (receiver) pulls the message from the

trans-unit.source: queue and processes it.
trans-unit.target: queue and processes it.

trans-unit.source: The producer does not have to wait for a reply
trans-unit.target: The producer does not have to wait for a reply

trans-unit.source: from the consumer in order to continue to process and send further
trans-unit.target: from the consumer in order to continue to process and send further

trans-unit.source: messages.
trans-unit.target: messages.

trans-unit.source: Queues offer **First In, First Out (FIFO)** message delivery
trans-unit.target: Queues offer **First In, First Out (FIFO)** message delivery

trans-unit.source: to one or more competing consumers.
trans-unit.target: to one or more competing consumers.

trans-unit.source: That is, messages are typically
trans-unit.target: That is, messages are typically

trans-unit.source: received and processed by the receivers in the order in which they were
trans-unit.target: received and processed by the receivers in the order in which they were

trans-unit.source: added to the queue, and each message is received and processed by only
trans-unit.target: added to the queue, and each message is received and processed by only

trans-unit.source: one message consumer.
trans-unit.target: one message consumer.

trans-unit.source: QueueConcepts
trans-unit.target: QueueConcepts

trans-unit.source: Service Bus queues are a general-purpose technology that can be used for
trans-unit.target: Service Bus queues are a general-purpose technology that can be used for

trans-unit.source: a wide variety of scenarios:
trans-unit.target: a wide variety of scenarios:

trans-unit.source: Communication between web and worker roles in a multi-tier
trans-unit.target: Communication between web and worker roles in a multi-tier

trans-unit.source: Azure application.
trans-unit.target: Azure application.

trans-unit.source: Communication between on-premises apps and Azure hosted apps
trans-unit.target: Communication between on-premises apps and Azure hosted apps

trans-unit.source: in a hybrid solution.
trans-unit.target: in a hybrid solution.

trans-unit.source: Communication between components of a distributed application
trans-unit.target: Communication between components of a distributed application

trans-unit.source: running on-premises in different organizations or departments of an
trans-unit.target: running on-premises in different organizations or departments of an

trans-unit.source: organization.
trans-unit.target: organization.

trans-unit.source: Using queues enables you to scale out your applications more easily, and
trans-unit.target: Using queues enables you to scale out your applications more easily, and

trans-unit.source: enable more resiliency to your architecture.
trans-unit.target: enable more resiliency to your architecture.

trans-unit.source: Create a service namespace
trans-unit.target: Create a service namespace

trans-unit.source: To begin using Service Bus queues in Azure, you must first
trans-unit.target: To begin using Service Bus queues in Azure, you must first

trans-unit.source: create a service namespace.
trans-unit.target: create a service namespace.

trans-unit.source: A namespace provides a scoping
trans-unit.target: A namespace provides a scoping

trans-unit.source: container for addressing Service Bus resources within your application.
trans-unit.target: container for addressing Service Bus resources within your application.

trans-unit.source: To create a service namespace:
trans-unit.target: To create a service namespace:

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal][].
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal][].

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane of the Management Portal, click
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane of the Management Portal, click

trans-unit.source: **Service Bus**.
trans-unit.target: **Service Bus**.

trans-unit.source: In the lower pane of the Management Portal, click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the lower pane of the Management Portal, click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add a new namespace** dialog, enter a namespace name.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add a new namespace** dialog, enter a namespace name.

trans-unit.source: The system immediately checks to see if the name is available.
trans-unit.target: The system immediately checks to see if the name is available.

trans-unit.source: After making sure the namespace name is available, choose the
trans-unit.target: After making sure the namespace name is available, choose the

trans-unit.source: country or region in which your namespace should be hosted (make
trans-unit.target: country or region in which your namespace should be hosted (make

trans-unit.source: sure you use the same country/region in which you are deploying your
trans-unit.target: sure you use the same country/region in which you are deploying your

trans-unit.source: compute resources).
trans-unit.target: compute resources).

trans-unit.source: IMPORTANT: Pick the **same region** that you intend to choose for
trans-unit.target: IMPORTANT: Pick the **same region** that you intend to choose for

trans-unit.source: deploying your application.
trans-unit.target: deploying your application.

trans-unit.source: This will give you the best performance.
trans-unit.target: This will give you the best performance.

trans-unit.source: Leave the other fields in the dialog with their default values (**Messaging** and **Standard Tier**), then click the check mark.
trans-unit.target: Leave the other fields in the dialog with their default values (**Messaging** and **Standard Tier**), then click the check mark.

trans-unit.source: The system now creates your namespace and enables it.
trans-unit.target: The system now creates your namespace and enables it.

trans-unit.source: You might have to wait several minutes as the system provisions resources for your account.
trans-unit.target: You might have to wait several minutes as the system provisions resources for your account.

trans-unit.source: The namespace you created takes a moment to activate, and will then appear in the management portal.
trans-unit.target: The namespace you created takes a moment to activate, and will then appear in the management portal.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the namespace status is **Active** before continuing.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the namespace status is **Active** before continuing.

trans-unit.source: Obtain the default management credentials for the namespace
trans-unit.target: Obtain the default management credentials for the namespace

trans-unit.source: In order to perform management operations, such as creating a queue on
trans-unit.target: In order to perform management operations, such as creating a queue on

trans-unit.source: the new namespace, you must obtain the management credentials for the
trans-unit.target: the new namespace, you must obtain the management credentials for the

trans-unit.source: namespace.
trans-unit.target: namespace.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain these credentials from the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain these credentials from the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: To obtain management credentials from the portal
trans-unit.target: To obtain management credentials from the portal

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, click the **Service Bus** node, to
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, click the **Service Bus** node, to

trans-unit.source: display the list of available namespaces:
trans-unit.target: display the list of available namespaces:

trans-unit.source: Click on the namespace you just created from the list shown.
trans-unit.target: Click on the namespace you just created from the list shown.

trans-unit.source: Click **Configure** to view the shared access policies for your namespace.
trans-unit.target: Click **Configure** to view the shared access policies for your namespace.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the primary key, or copy it to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the primary key, or copy it to the clipboard.
